citations.narrative:
Space. Insufficient space was being provided in the following enclosures:
* Enclosure # 9 housing approximately 68 weanling guinea pigs.
* Enclosure # 10 housing approximately 29 adult guinea pigs with10 newborn.
Both enclosures measured 36 inches by 48 inches or 1728 square inches of floor space. Weanling guinea pigs weighing
up to 350 grams require at least 60 square inches of floor space each. Guinea pigs weighing over 350 grams and nursing
females with litters require at least 101 square inches of floor space each. Can not house more that 28 weanling guinea
pigs in this size enclosure. Can not house more than 17 adult guinea pigs with their offspring in this size enclosure.
Inadequate floor space can cause stress, aggression, and increase disease risks in animals. Licensee must ensure that at
least the minimum amount of floor space per guinea pig is provided to prevent stress and discomfort. Correct by March
17, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section
